intro: Tetramerium diffusum, commonly known as the spreading tetramerium, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Asia and is characterized by its woody stems and palmate leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in horticultural settings.
